title: The Haircut
description: A mother takes her teenage son to the hairdressers. He hates having his hair cut. Within an hour their day unravels. This poignant short story explores autism as a different way of being and how a mother's love endures. Newly edited version adapted from the original, shortlisted for the 2019 Aurora National Short Fiction Prize awarded by Writing East Midlands in partnership with The Society of Authors
author: Wendy Davey
